item_details.html.original: This plastic item can be sent to the municipality for raw material processing.
Rinse containers to remove food residue
Remove caps and lids (they can often be recycled separately)
Check for recycling symbols (1-7) to identify plastic type
Compress items to save space during transport
Remove any plastic windows or non-paper materials
Flatten cardboard boxes to save space
Shredded paper may require special handling
Aluminum cans can be crushed to save space
Some metals have higher recycling value than others
Rinse containers to remove food residue
Remove lids and caps (they're often made of different materials)
Sort by color if required by your local recycling program
Back up and erase all personal data
Look for specialized e-waste collection events

marketplace.html.original: Be the first to list a recyclable item in the marketplace!

municipality.html.original: How Plastic Waste is Used in Construction:
Mixed with asphalt to create stronger, longer-lasting roads
Made from compressed plastic waste for affordable housing
Adding processed plastic to concrete to improve durability
Converting plastics into weather-resistant roofing materials
Creating public benches and tables from recycled plastics
Decreases landfill waste and plastic pollution in waterways
Reduces need for new plastic production, saving oil and energy
Creates durable materials with unique properties for building
No items sent to municipality yet

report_infrastructure.html.original: Upload a clear photo of the infrastructure issue
Include landmarks in the photo to help identify the location
Be specific about the location in your description
Rate severity honestly based on safety risk and impact
Provide contact details if you wish to be updated on the resolution
As a thank you for helping improve your community, you'll receive:
when your reported issue is resolved
Track your contributions in your user profile
Top contributors will be featured on our Community Champions leaderboard!
